intro: Arabis media var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant produces clusters of small, white, four-petaled flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered with glandular hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
